physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Retrosternal discomfort, dysphagia, odynophagia, subjective fevers and chills.

1-month history of fever, chills, non-productive cough, and diffuse body aches; CT demonstrated lymphadenopathy in cervical, supraclavicular, hilar, mediastinal, retroperitoneal, and upper abdominal areas.
Diagnosed with acute coccidioidal pneumonia, improved with fluconazole.
Developed right supraclavicular lymphadenopathy and a nasal lesion; spherules were seen on biopsy.
Granulomatous osteomyelitis with spherules in the right proximal tibia; cultures grew Coccidioides species.
